intro: Hypocalymma schollerifolium, commonly known as the Scholler's hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, woody fruits. Hypocalymma schollerifolium is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
